GERMANS* (1) Appointment of German Consu at Muscat* From To Previous NumberS 1935—2,000-3-06 Cl) To No- £ZLO 6 of 1906 •c-N British Residency and Consulate-General f <N' Bushire, Sep tember 190 6. The POLITICAL AGENT, and H .IVs Consul, MUSCAT. Sir, Uitb reference to the entry in your last, week's ^iary regarding tiie possible appointment of a German Consul at Muscat, I have the honour to request that you will report fully on the subject. I would point out that Germany has no Commercial Treaty with the Sultan of Muscat which would entitle her to accredit a Consul to his Capital, and shall • e glad to know what overtures if any have been made to His Highness on the subject. I have the honour to be Sir, Your most obedient servant, Z? - Major, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.■ N \ D raft To, No ^6' Of 1906 D/ ?4_ . Political Posidont, Sir, I hav© th© honour to s-abmit th© fcllOTving report with reference to your letter No 2209 dated the 16th September 1906. 2. Th© rumour was noted in this Agency Diary for what it was worth, and in the hope that the entry would draw attention to any simi- -lar rumours which might be expected to be current 0^ ^iycauL IfiU kr') j in Bushire^ No doubt 'the idea found its origin IdLYC- in the recent arrival of the first vessel of the Hamburg-American S.S*Company’s Persian G^ulf service* & 3. U&il~ ^‘CY m Ui~4u*y Ty^ to sounding tthe Sultan I had alread.y referred to H*H* on the subject en- -quiring whether he had heard anything in this connection* H*H® replied that he himself had lrul~ only heard the ordinary bazaar gossip auA, had not been approached on the subject * In fact^he ©x- -pressed, surprise that I should have expected him to know anything of the matter when I myself Hrfi' had h^Tnc news, as supposed that any such in- -formation would^\ave\certainly) been conveyed through this Agency* I have etc.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/5 Foreign Interests: Appointment of German Consul to Muscat'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between the Political Residency in Bushire and the Political Agency in Muscat regarding a rumour that a German Consul was to be appointed in Muscat.
